SKATER COLLECTION

Skateboarding culture has become increasingly popular worldwide in recent years. Shinpei Ueno and Alex Olson, both skaters who started out on the streets, are now active in multiple fields, including fashion, design, and film. This collection features their artworks drawn exclusively for UT and a newly developed T-shirt silhouette.

Shinpei Ueno
As well as overseeing TIGHTBOOTH PRODUCTION, he also skates for Evisen Skateboards as a pro skater. He has released many skateboarding videos, and his most well-known work, â€œLENZ II,â€ was highly acclaimed both in Japan and abroad. He works in a wide variety of fields, including direction for a skate shop and apparel brand, and production for numerous brands. â€œLENZ III,â€ which completes the TIGHTBOOTH skateboarding video trilogy, was released worldwide in November 2022.

â€œThe Bling Ringâ€ (2013)
Based on a true story in the U.S., this documentary-style film depicts the unique morals of today's youth living in social networks.

"LET'S GO SHOPPING"
This is a symbolic phrase uttered by Rebecca, the leader of the group, in the main scene of the story in which the youths break into the homes of celebrities and steal brand-name goods.

Celebrating Sofia Coppola

The film by Sofia Coppola, celebrating the 25th anniversary of her debut, offers a beautiful view of the world with straightforward language and unique visual beauty that makes life seem still. The film expresses the girly sentiments of the women in the film with an exquisite and feminine aesthetic. We designed a T-shirt using the scenes and lines depicted in the film. The body silhouette, which has a girly nuance but is also easy for men to wear, is also noteworthy.

Sofia Coppola
Born in 1971 and raised in Northern California, Sofia Coppola released her first feature film, The Virgin Suicides, as the director and screenwriter in 1999. Sofia has created seven feature films to date. Beloved by fans for the artistry and originality of her scripts, she was awarded Best Director at the 2017 Cannes Film Festival.

SKATER COLLECTION

Skateboarding culture has become increasingly popular worldwide in recent years. Shinpei Ueno and Alex Olson, both skaters who started out on the streets, are now active in multiple fields, including fashion, design, and film. This collection features their artworks drawn exclusively for UT and a newly developed T-shirt silhouette.

Shinpei Ueno
As well as overseeing TIGHTBOOTH PRODUCTION, he also skates for Evisen Skateboards as a pro skater. He has released many skateboarding videos, and his most well-known work, â€œLENZ II,â€ was highly acclaimed both in Japan and abroad. He works in a wide variety of fields, including direction for a skate shop and apparel brand, and production for numerous brands. â€œLENZ III,â€ which completes the TIGHTBOOTH skateboarding video trilogy, was released worldwide in November 2022.

Yusuke Hanai

Yusuke Hanai is a renowned graphic artist known for his unique style, heavily influenced by the counterculture of the '50s and '60s. He seamlessly blends Japanese aesthetic sensibility with retro American illustration. This collection of graphic T-shirts is based on the theme of "ONE STEP FORWARD," promoting environmentally conscious actions, and features his latest artwork printed on fabric made from recycled polyester.

Yusuke Hanai
Born in 1978, Yusuke Hanai is a globally recognized artist, having exhibited his works in various countries including the United States, France, Australia, Brazil, Taiwan, England. His style, characterized by its cynical and humorous storytelling, has garnered widespread attention both in Japan and internationally.

Â© Yusuke Hanai

Graphic design inspired by the Wind God and Thunder God hanging scrolls by the great painter and woodblock artist Kawanabe KyÅsai (1831â€“1889).
In Japanese mythology, the Wind God wields a cloth bag that unleashes torrential wind and rain. Since ancient times, the Wind God has been revered for its ability to calm typhoons and storms that wreak havoc on crops.
This T-shirt depicts the mighty Wind God on a background the color of traditional Japanese persimmon-dyed textiles.

Japanese Art from the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston

The Museum of Fine Arts, Boston, is one of the premier art institutions in the world. The museum is renowned for its vast collection of Japanese artwork and long history of cultural exchange with Japan. A selection of the museumâ€™s masterworks from Japan can now be enjoyed in a new collaboration with UNIQLO, inspired by iconic designs including Kawanabe KyÅsaiâ€™s Wind God and Thunder God, Hasegawa TÅhakuâ€™s Dragon and Tiger.

Director Makoto Shinkai Profile

Born in Nagano Prefecture, Japan in 1973, Makoto Shinkai makes his commercial debut with the short film he produced on his own, â€œVoices of a Distant Star.â€ Since, he has gone onto direct films such as â€œThe Place Promised in Our Early Days (2004),â€ â€œ5 Centimeters per Second (2007),â€ â€œChildren Who Chase Lost Voices (2011)â€ and â€œThe Garden of Words (2013).â€ Finally, in 2016, he directs â€œYour Name,â€ an international sensation and social phenomenon in Japan, and quickly follows it up with â€œWeathering with Youâ€ in 2019, which set box office records in Japan. In November 2022, his latest film, â€œSuzumeâ€ will be shown in domestic movie theaters.

Graphic design inspired by the Wind God and Thunder God hanging scrolls by the great painter and woodblock artist Kawanabe KyÅsai (1831â€“1889).
In Japanese mythology, the Wind God wields a cloth bag that unleashes torrential wind and rain. Since ancient times, the Wind God has been revered for its ability to calm typhoons and storms that wreak havoc on crops.
This sweatshirt the color of traditional Japanese plant-dyes pays tribute to the mighty Wind God on the back, with leaves dancing in the wind on the front.

Japanese Art from the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston

Featuring the 25th anniversary of Sofia Coppola, the film director who ignited feminine culture, the design expresses her world view with the title logos of her representative works. It can be worn alone or styled with a T-shirt that is linked to the design.

Celebrating Sofia Coppola

The film by Sofia Coppola, celebrating the 25th anniversary of her debut, offers a beautiful view of the world with straightforward language and unique visual beauty that makes life seem still. The film expresses the girly sentiments of the women in the film with an exquisite and feminine aesthetic. We designed a T-shirt using the scenes and lines depicted in the film. The body silhouette, which has a girly nuance but is also easy for men to wear, is also noteworthy.

Sofia Coppola
Born in 1971 and raised in Northern California, Sofia Coppola released her first feature film, The Virgin Suicides, as the director and screenwriter in 1999. Sofia has created seven feature films to date. Beloved by fans for the artistry and originality of her scripts, she was awarded Best Director at the 2017 Cannes Film Festival.

items.longDescription:
The Message

T-shirts often reflect the thoughts, and trends of our times. Long before social media, T-shirts were a canvas on which people everywhere could freely express their messages. We returned to the origin of the graphic T-shirt and collaborated with three contemporary artists who lead the art scene in the U.S. and London.

Trevor Andrew
Trevor Andrew is a former professional snowboarder who is known today as a fine artist and digital designer featuring his signature motifs and monograms. Andrew's artistic appropriation of consumer culture fuses pop art sensibility with skateboard culture aesthetics. His works have been exhibited in V&A Museum London, Modern Art Museum, Shanghai and Jeffrey Deitch gallery NY.

Trevor Andrew
items.name: UV Protection Cap Trevor Andrew
items.shortDescription: A lineup of caps filled with messages from three contemporary artists.

items.longDescription:
The Message

T-shirts often reflect the thoughts, and trends of our times. Long before social media, T-shirts were a canvas on which people everywhere could freely express their messages. We returned to the origin of the graphic T-shirt and collaborated with three contemporary artists who lead the art scene in the U.S. and London.

Lakwena
Lakwena means 'messenger of the chief' in the northern Ugandan language of Acholi. Born in 1986, Lakwena's name is reflected in her artistic practice, which is primarily focused on messages. Utilizing bright color and bold text, Lakwena creates eye-catching and instantly recognizable paintings which can be understood to be "escape routes, afrofuturistic portals to utopia".

items.washingInformation:
Hand Wash
Rinse thoroughly in water at 30 degrees Celsius / 86 degrees Fahrenheit or less before putting in a washing machine.
Soaking for around 30 minutes with the absorbent layer facing downwards will make it easier to remove stains.
Machine Wash
Wash in a laundry net. Avoid washing with bleach or softener, as this may reduce the absorbency.
Dry
Allow to dry naturally. Do not use a dryer.
